properties.address: Inspire Culture Learning & Libraries, Worksop, Nottinghamshire S81 7EF
properties.description: Discover a welcoming place to read, learn, and enjoy culture at Inspire Libraries. Whether you want to browse and borrow books, use a PC, research family history, or simply relax in our refreshment areas, we have something for everyone. Join our regular events—perfect for meeting new people and trying activities like crafting, colouring, reading groups, and children’s sessions. Looking to learn? Our Adult Learning courses offer a friendly environment to gain new skills or explore a hobby just for fun. Experience cultural events close to home, from jazz and author talks to family concerts, theatre, workshops, and more—all in a welcoming space right in your local community

properties.address: The Glapwell Centre, Chesterfield, Derbyshire S44 5LW
properties.description: We offer a weekly programme of inclusive, community-focused activities designed to support wellbeing, reduce isolation, and foster connection. Our space is open and welcoming, with someone on-site most weekdays from 9am to 3pm, ensuring visitors can always drop in for a chat, a cuppa, or simply a place to rest. Monday – (our main Welcome space day!) Welcome Space & Chair-Based Exercise From 10am, we invite people in for tea, biscuits, and friendly conversation. At 11:15am, Alison leads a gentle chair-based exercise class suitable for all abilities. At 12pm, we serve a hearty hot meal with dessert, followed by more tea and coffee. The session typically winds down by 2pm, but the space remains accessible from 9am to 3pm. Tuesday – Community Café Our café runs from 10:30am to 12:30pm, offering affordable refreshments and a relaxed social atmosphere. Anyone experiencing hardship is discreetly offered free tea or coffee. The venue is staffed from 9am to 3pm, so visitors are welcome to pop in at any time. Wednesday – Open Drop-In & Bingo From 10am to 4pm, the space is open for anyone seeking warmth, company, or a quiet moment. We also host a friendly bingo session, open to all, which brings laughter and light-hearted competition. Thursday – Quiet Access Day While no formal activities are scheduled, the centre is staffed from 9am to 3pm. Visitors are welcome to drop in for a chat, a drink, or simply to enjoy the warm, safe environment. Friday – Activity Hub Running from 10am to 12pm, this free session encourages gentle physical activity and social interaction. We offer games such as indoor curling, darts, cards, and Scrabble. Bacon or sausage cobs are available to purchase, and tea and coffee are served throughout. The centre remains open from 9am to 3pm for anyone needing support or company. Weekends – Community Events & Private Hire Saturdays and Sundays are typically reserved for private bookings, but when community events are scheduled, we warmly welcome all attendees.
properties.title: The Glapwell Centre Guardians

properties.address: AFTTE College, Sutton-in-Ashfield, Nottinghamshire NG17 1DH
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 22nd January 2026** Veolia's Warm Welcome Space launches on 22 January, in Nottinghamshire where Veolia delivers essential recycling and waste treatment operations. The Warm Welcome Space is completely free and open to anyone in Nottinghamshire needing a safe, warm place or community connection. Visitors will find hot meals, career cafés, and access to Shelter’s support. With games and activities for all ages, the spaces also help to combat isolation, as well as ensuring access to essential resources and advice. The site will offer unique activities to deliver on Veolia’s responsibility as an environmental champion, so visitors can expect to take away practical and sustainable skills to support them beyond the winter sessions. In Nottinghamshire, this includes recycling advice and games. Nottinghamshire’s Warm Welcome Space will be held on Thursdays at ATTFE College 9-11 Low Street, Sutton in Ashfield, Nottinghamshire NG17 1DH. There is no prior registration required; visitors can simply turn up on the day and be welcomed in. The local Sutton in Ashfield space will be held on afternoons after typical school hours between 3.30pm and 5.30pm to provide relief for residents of all ages with complimentary nutritious meals, a warm refuge during the coldest hours, and an inclusive after-school hub where the community can gather, connect, and exchange support.
properties.title: Veolia Nottinghamshire Warm Welcome Space

Inspiringinkersall@hotmail.com Provide free activities that encourage people to spend time in a safe, warm, and friendly environment. Regular lunch clubs give local residents the chance to enjoy a hot, nutritious meal while socialising with others. Coffee mornings will provide a relaxed setting for conversation, reducing loneliness and helping people feel connected. To promote health and wellbeing, we will run free sports and gentle exercise sessions for adults and children, encouraging people to stay active while benefiting from the warmth and comfort of our venue. Alongside these regular activities, we will host community events and seasonal gatherings to bring neighbours together. Mon- Fri 10am-4pm Open all year
